Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.index

Class IndexDirectoryStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.api.index.IndexDirectoryStructure
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IndexDirectoryStructure.SubDirectoryByIndexId
    public abstract class IndexDirectoryStructure
extends Object
    Dictates how directory structure looks for an IndexProvider and its indexes. Generally there's a root directory which contains all index directories in some shape and form. For getting a directory (which must be a sub-directory to the root directory) for a particular index there's the directoryForIndex(long) method. These instances are created from a IndexDirectoryStructure.Factory which typically gets passed into an IndexProvider constructor, which then creates a IndexDirectoryStructure given its IndexProviderDescriptor.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Creates an IndexDirectoryStructure for a IndexProviderDescriptor for an IndexProvider.

    • Method Detail

      • baseSchemaIndexFolder

        public static Path baseSchemaIndexFolder​(Path databaseStoreDir)
        Returns the base schema index directory, i.e. 
         <db>/schema/index/
        Parameters:
        databaseStoreDir - database store directory, i.e. db in the example above, where e.g. nodestore lives.
        Returns:
        the base directory of schema indexing.

      • directoriesByProvider

        public static IndexDirectoryStructure.Factory directoriesByProvider​(Path databaseStoreDir)
        Parameters:
        databaseStoreDir - store directory of database, i.e. db in the example above.
        Returns:
        IndexDirectoryStructure.Factory for creating IndexDirectoryStructure returning directories looking something like: 
         <db>/schema/index/<providerKey>-<providerVersion>/<indexId>/

        Returns:

      • directoriesBySubProvider

        public static IndexDirectoryStructure.Factory directoriesBySubProvider​(IndexDirectoryStructure parentStructure)
        Useful when combining multiple IndexProvider into one.
        Parameters:
        parentStructure - IndexDirectoryStructure of the parent.
        Returns:
        IndexDirectoryStructure.Factory creating IndexDirectoryStructure looking something like: 
         <db>/schema/index/.../<indexId>/<childProviderKey>-<childProviderVersion>/

      • fileNameFriendly

        public static String fileNameFriendly​(String name)

      • fileNameFriendly

        static String fileNameFriendly​(IndexProviderDescriptor descriptor)

      • rootDirectory

        public abstract Path rootDirectory()
        Returns root directory. Must be parent (one or more steps) to all sub-directories returned from directoryForIndex(long). Returns something equivalent to: 
         <db>/schema/index/<provider>/
        Returns:
        Path denoting root directory for this provider. May return null if there's no root directory, i.e. no persistent storage at all.

      • directoryForIndex

        public abstract Path directoryForIndex​(long indexId)
        Returns a sub-directory (somewhere under rootDirectory()) for a specific index id, looking something equivalent to: 
         <db>/schema/index/<provider>/<indexId>/
        I.e. the root of the schema indexes for this specific provider.
        Parameters:
        indexId - index id to return directory for.
        Returns:
        Path denoting directory for the specific indexId for this provider. May return null if there's no root directory, i.e. no persistent storage at all.
